author: parithosh
content:
Honestly if you guys think local machines are the bottleneck, I can figure out how to get around it. Either get you guys access to a k8s cluster or a really beefy server somewhere. It seems like a group of 5-10 devs need access, which isnt too hard and a lot of you work in different timezones anyway. Kurtosis already does segmentation by enclave, so you won't be overwriting each others work. 

Its clear that we'd have to optimize away that bottleneck in the future, but if its gets the ball rolling short term then its fixable with money. Happy to discuss it on the peerdas breakout call if this is a strong ask.

author: agnxsh
content: I think we can discuss this after 1 week more of bug fixing atleast, such that we are 100% sure whatever is happening is a CPU utilisation issue and not unforced incorrectness

author: agnxsh
content: But yeah the discussion can happen in the breakout definitely

author: parithosh
content:
I've set min resource limits too now:
â”‚     Limits:                                                                                                         
â”‚       cpu:     8                                                                                                     
â”‚       memory:  8192M                                                                                     
â”‚     Requests:                                                                                                   
â”‚       cpu:        3500m                                                                                      
â”‚       memory:     7G

So min 3.5 cores and max 8 cores. Seems like the metric collection and labelling we use on the etherum-package needs some work, because i imported the node exporter graph and it didnt work at all. 

So i had to resort to kubectl commands to figure out whats going on. 

`kubectl top node` returns this:
```
NAME                       CPU(cores)   CPU%   MEMORY(bytes)   MEMORY%
chaos-ams3-default-rvlt6   117m         1%     6012Mi          43%
chaos-ams3-default-rvlta   204m         2%     5612Mi          40%
chaos-ams3-default-rvltt   469m         5%     6516Mi          47%
chaos-ams3-default-wunf7   239m         3%     2499Mi          18%
chaos-ams3-default-wunfc   136m         1%     3672Mi          26%
chaos-ams3-default-wunfm   302m         3%     3333Mi          24%
```

^ indicates there's enough spare resources to use

I've also attached an image that showcases the live usage, seems to me like it has enough resources to spike up to
